title: girl 7 traumatised after bb
story: Girl, , traumatised after BB gun pellet hits her below eye on market tripJoanne Davies said daughter Lillie-Mai, seven, has been left scared to leave the house and woke up screaming and vomiting the evening after the incident at Accrington Market, LancashireLillie-Mai, seven, was struck on the cheek by the BB gun pellet Image: MEN MEDIAByFatima AzizRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Feb |comments A little girl was lucky not to have been blinded after being shot in the face with a BB gun, says her mum.Joanne Davies said daughter Lillie-Mai, seven, has been left scared to leave the house and suffering night traumas following the incident at Accrington Market, in Lancashire, last Saturday. While coming back from the toilets, some youths standing on a nearby balcony allegedly fired a small metal pellet from an air gun, which struck the child.Joanne said Lillie-Maiaposs cheek was left red and inflamed, just an inch below her eye, reports Lancs Live. They were on a day out with the girlaposs godmother and her daughter to take part in craft sessions - due to it being the first Saturday market of the month - when the incident occurred.  The group went for lunch at a cafe just outside the markets and Lillie-Mai was on the way back from the toilets with her godmother when she was shot. Joanne, from Whitworth, said: Next thing I heard was a lot of shouting and I recognised the voice of my friend. Next minute my daughter appears at the table, holding her face, crying, sobbing her heart out and sheaposs going, aposmummy Iaposve been shot in the face, Iaposve been shot in the faceapos. You can imagine what I thought. Her godmother said theyaposd seen a group of youths hanging around and at least one was holding a BB gun.  Joanne said: What weighsapos on my mind heavily, and Iaposve to got to be thankful it wasnapost, but an inch higher, sheaposd have lost her eye - it was a metal ball bearing. That night Lillie-Mai woke up an hour after going to bed and was screaming, she was shaking, she started vomiting, her mum said. The next day she point-blank refused to leave the house and Joanne said she had a battle to get her to go to school on Monday. It has signicantly affected her, she added. Joanne rang police over the incident and officers are now investigating. The mum has issued a warning to the parents of the youths, saying she wants the culprits to know of the great trauma theyaposve inflicted on her little girl. Hyndburn Police has also issued a warning to parents over the dangers of the weapons and said this sort of behaviour will not be tolerated. A spokesperson said officers were called to the market hall on Saturday, February , at around pm to reports of youths with BB guns running around. Officers have since seized the gun and pellets they believe are linked to the incident with Lillie-Mai. title: i stand outside asda asking
story: I stand outside Asda asking shoppers for electric money and have p to my nameMick Thompson can be spotted standing outside Asda pleading for any spare change and today bravely reveals his plight in Leeds to highlight Leeds extremely challenging homelessness problemMick Thompson Image: MEN MediaBySamuel PortGraeme Murray:,  Feb |comments A desperate man who has aposp to his nameapos has bravely told how he has been forced to turn to pleading with customers outside an Asda supermarket for aposelectric moneyaposMick Thompson is often spotted asking people for cash outside the entrace to the supermarket in Leeds and spoke with a reporter about his plight. He is desperate for cash and tells customers: I need some money for electric” before pleading with them for any change. LeedsLive reports Mick had just p to his name and he is staying at a friend’s flat whilst his pal is on holiday. The -year-old is often seen sleeping rough and chooses to sleep in bushes where the foliage provides some respite from the cold.Do you have a brave story to tell  Email webnews@mirror  Mick, originally from Leeds, West Yorkshire, says he suffers from a “psychosis of some kind” which causes forgetfulness and makes him walk on the spot. He’s found some labouring work, digging up holes to pitch fences, but decided not to turn up and went to Asda instead. And he says there are lots of “kind and very nice people” who enter the Asda, east Leeds where he has ed for about a week. Mick also commended the security staff there, calling them “good people”.But he explained how desperate his situation is when he has been unable to sleep on peopleaposs floors or rely on friends for a bed for the night. He said: “I’ve had to sleep rough loads of times, it’s b****y cold. I’ve slept in bushes just down here [Harehills Lane], doorways and all over the place. “It’s very uncomfortable, it’s cold and there’s no mattress. I usually just have a coat to sleep on. The bush just stops the wind and that. I look for any bush that’ll keep me conserved.  Get all the latest news sent to your inbox.for the free Mirror newsletter “I look for somewhere I can light a campfire, that’s what’s most important.”Mick says the best location for a camp fire is Temple Newsam, where he’s slept a couple times.He claims to have been begging for about  years since losing his labouring job. “I was smoking near a blasting site. Its got explosives near it,” he said regretfully, about losing his job. Mick claims the most he’s received from someone whilst begging is a couple of pounds. Asda declined to comment on the regular appearance of Mr Thompson outside the supermarket.Leeds City Council last year said many of the issues associated with rough sleepers and the homeless remained “extremely challenging” and were committed to doing “everything possible” to offer the best possible support.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON AsdaHomelessnesspoverty" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news i-visited-worlds-largest-greggs-"The Mirror visits worlds largest Greggs in the worlds biggest PrimarkByJulia BanimAudience Writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsAs a keen bargain hunter, I’ve naturally heard tell of Birmingham’s famed Primark - the largest in the world no less - but have never had an excuse to visit.So you can imagine my delight upon learning that the store would now be home to the biggest Greggs on the planet. As reported last week, Greggs has teamed up with Primark for the very first time on a unique cafe experience and clothing range. The collab feels like a long overdue fit for the two high street legends, with Nottingham-based interior designer Philip Watts bringing a fun and energetic feel to whataposs been described as the most ‘Instagrammable Greggs in the world’.The doors to Tasty by Greggs officially open in Primarkaposs giant flagship store on Saturday, February . However, I was fortunate enough to get a sneak peek ahead of the launch, and feel I can now at long last officially add the role of apospasty influencerapos to my CV.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. Although the Tasty by Greggs cafe is far more than just your average Greggs, the menu will be very familiar to all Greggs fans, with all your favourite treats present and correct - nothing brand new or dferent being sold here.Seems a bit of a shame they didnapost decide to create a limited-edition Primark-themed doughnut or something with bright neon colours to match the playful interior. With nothing new on offer to tantalise my tastebuds, I opted for a trusty vegan sausage roll followed by a sugar strand doughnut, all washed down with a vanilla latte from the quirky self-serve coffee cart. Although I know not everyone is keen on self-service coffee, I personally enjoyed this aspect of the restaurant, which really does enhance the relaxed feel of the place. I can absolutely imagine nipping in for aposjust one coffeeapos before staying for three. As big as the cafe and host store are, the sausage rolls and doughnuts were unfortunately standard-sized, which was, admittedly, another small disappointment. However, it does mean thereaposs always room to eat more!  Being Northern, Iaposm more than happy queuing up at small Greggsapos chains during hurried lunch break runs. However, Tasty by Greggs brings a completely new dynamic to the beloved bakery experience that I didnapost even know I needed in my le until now.You will also still very much feel like you are in Greggs, albeit Greggs when looked at through an influencer-worthy Instagram filter. Tasty takes things to the next level, seating as many as  people in a spacious and above all very chilled-out space. However, despite its size, Tasty doesn’t have the sort of impersonal, hectic feel that a lot of large high street cafes have. Divided into distinct sections, Tasty has a fun, home-from-home feel, and you can absolutely imagine flopping down here with your shopping bags to st through new purchases at your leisure. Those wanting a summery feel in drizzly February can park themselves in the light and airy Greggs picnic area, which is fitted with picnic benches well-suited to weekend catch-ups over brews. Meanwhile, selfie lovers will be in their element, with the most ‘Instagrammable Greggs in the world’ certainly living up to its name.My personal favourite feature was the cute sprinkle doughnut swing, surrounded by neon signage and tailor-made to show off your latest Primark haul.I can imagine this will prove popular, so Iaposd definitely advise grabbing yourself a seat at one of the nearby half doughnut booths while you wait for it to free up.  Much like the chain thataposs kept Brits coming back again and again since , Tasty offers a friendly, welcoming experience, all while bringing something a little new and vibrant - itaposs the perfect accompaniment to any serious Primark shopping spree. Tasty by Greggs will open at Primark’s Birmingham store at . am on Saturday, February , and can be found between men’s and ladieswear on Primark’s - Mezzanine floor. Will you be visiting the worldaposs largest Greggs  Let us know in the comments below. title: man 32 becomes first brit
story: Man, , becomes first Brit with Downs syndrome to become fully qualied scaffolderTodd Scanlon, , was offered an apprenticeship by a company four years ago and has since impressed with his eagerness and professionalismTodd Scanlon has Downs syndrome and works as a scaffolder Image: Tom Wren   SWNSByLouie SmithNews Reporter:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb A man is to hit new heights as the first Brit with Down’s syndrome to become a fully qualied scaffolder. Todd Scanlon, , was offered an apprenticeship by a company four years ago and has since impressed with his eagerness and professionalism. He has also recently been accepted onto a course to gain his qualications. Proud mum Vicky Scanlon praised his boss Martyn Coles for giving her son a chance. She said: “You’ve helped Todd achieve so much – physically, mentally, passing courses and getting awards.”  Todd was hired by Coles Scaffolding in October  and quickly became a valued worker. Speaking after joining, he said: “I mainly do a lot of fittings and carrying. I wanted to go into scaffolding because it’s my favourite thing to do.” Todd was later named the UK’s top apprentice and Martyn said he has no regrets about hiring him. He explained: “Having him on the site is great, he’s a good presence, all of the customers like him. He comes in every day and proves people wrong.” Vicky said Todd’s success story highlights the dficulty people with disabilities can have finding employment. She added: “When Todd was growing up you get used to the idea he won’t have the same le as everybody , but with Martyn doing this for him he’s getting there.” Todd, from Swindon, Wilts, works alongside five colleagues and his role involves ensuring the scaffolding is safe and level. Martyn’s firm has adopted the slogan “No Stigma” to show Todd’s disability does not hinder him. Martyn said: “We want to show he can do it. Everyone is entitled to work. Todd does all the same tasks as us.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Downs syndromeApprenticeships" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news mans-shock-after-cctv-shows-"Connahs Quay: Delivery driver appears to attempt to open front doorByHarri EvansMichele Theil:,  Feb |comments A man was left shocked when a Hermes courier driver tried to enter his home to drop off a parcel after he didnapost answer the door. The resident watched the incident on his home CCTV camera at around noon last Friday , reports North Wales Live.He was in the bathroom of his three-bedroom home when he heard a knock at the door, followed immediately by the sound of the door handle being turned by the driver in question. The man, who wished to remain anonymous, said: I just think itaposs unusual. The Hermes delivery man pulled outside my house with a parcel, he walked up the drive, knocked the door, and then immediately pulled on the handle. I know what sound my front door makes when someoneaposs trying to open it. I was upstairs at the time in the bathroom and it was a bit of a shock.Have you had a similar encounter  Let us know at webnews@mirror He then ran from the bathroom to tell the driver to leave the parcel at the door. The resident added: I stuck my head out of a window to tell him. Iaposm not sure whether they should be doing it or not but it could be quite frighteningit was an elderly person living by themselves.  He added that the driver had his hood up which made it look like he was trying to hide [his] identity. He said: I sent a complaint to Hermes and they told me that the driver thought we had a porch and that he was trying to leave the parcel in it [a designated safe place]. However, the resident claried that they donapost have [a porch] and the door opens into [their] living room. EvenI did have a porch, I wouldnapost want people letting themselves in, he said. A spokesperson for Hermes said: We have raised this with the local team who have spoken to the courier involved. This was a genuine mistake as the courier believed it was a porch - we will ensure it wonapost happen again. title: mcdonalds opening right next burger
story: McDonalds is opening right next to my burger van pitch but I refuse to moveCarl George has sold burgers and hot dogs at the same site in Brynmawr, Blaenau Gwent for nearly two decades and has seen Asda, Home Bargains and Costa Coffee make the site their home - he now faces extra competition from McDonaldsCarl George insists he wont leave the site despite McDonalds opening a restaurant just yards away Image: WalesOnline  Rob BrowneByLewis SmithSam TrueloveNews reporter:,  Feb |comments A defiant burger van owner who has been selling food at the same spot for nearly  years is refusing to move despite a new McDonaldaposs restaurant opening just yards away.Carl George purchased the van for £, around  years ago and has been pitched at the site in Blaina Road, Brynmawr, Blaenau Gwent ever since.The -year-old, who sells thousands of pounds worth of food every month, has seen Asda, Home Bargains and Costa Coffee make the site their home in recent years, and now faces extra competition with McDonaldaposs opening a restaurant next month. Carl, who is based at the entrance of the retail park, is refusing to move however, reports Wales Online.Whose side are you on  Have your say in the comment section Iaposve lived in Brynmawr my entire le and have always worked in food and catering businesses because itaposs what I love to do. I donapost know how to do anything  to be honest with you and for me this van really is my livelihood and the way I support my family, he said. I bought the van for £, about  years ago and set myself up here on this corner even before the Asda was built and I have worked hard to make myself an established business in that time.  Weaposre busy every day with a lot of local tradesmen and service people but we also get a large amount of people coming for a bite to eat after theyaposve been to the shops as well. Itaposs been amazing and we have some brilliant customers so to think of losing that trade now is very worrying for me and my family. When it opens next month I will be only a few feet away from the drive-through though Iaposm surethey wanted to they could have situated it slightly dferently to account for me being here.  Luckily I own this small corner of land on a long-term lease so thereaposs no way they can make me move from my spot. At the moment I constantly have people coming over and asking what Iaposm going to do when it opens, because they see how it looks with me right next-door, but my answer has always remained the same. Iaposve worked hard to get to where I am and Iaposm not planning on moving any time soon.  The site in Blaina Road was formerly home to the Dunlop Semtex factory but has seen a number of regeneration projects over the past two decades. Carl admits he does feel threatened by the positioning of the new McDonaldaposs restaurant, mainly because the fast-food chain could have a severe impact on his business over time. The business owner, who sells a range of burgers and hot dogs, as well as daily specials such as pork rolls, hopes that after such a long stint in the Brynmawr area his customers will continue using his services.  Itaposs going to be a massive competition for us to have a giant food chain like this open up so close and of course I am feeling the pressure of going up against them because I really donapost know whataposs going to happen, he said. Whether or not it was built this way on purpose I really donapost know but either way nobody has ever spoken to me about the construction. Obviously you want to see new things being built but at the same time what they have done with this McDonaldaposs has been ridiculous and I really do feel threatened by it now.  I just hope people keep coming here so I can continue to make a living and doing what I love to do. At my age Iaposm too old to do anything  now so this is incredibly important to me and my family and could have a big impact on our lives. Iaposm just thankful that I do have so many loyal customers and the support Iaposve had from the people of the town and even around the borough has meant a lot. I guess weaposll just have to keep going and see what happens now but of course it is a worrying time. A McDonaldaposs spokesman said: “Our new restaurant in Brynmawr will bring signicant investment to the area and create at least  jobs for local people. We are proud of the positive role we play in the communities we serve and look forward to welcoming customers when we open in early spring.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON McDonalds CorporationSmall businessesMcDonalds" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news meghan-markle-really-upset-kate-"GMB: Richard Madeley says Harry and Meghan are moanersByDimitris Kouimtsidis:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsMeghan Markleaposs treatment of one of Kate Middletonaposs staffers during a “foot-stamping rant” at Kensington Palace left the Duchess “really upset”, a royal author has claimed.Tom Quinn, author of Kensington Palace: An Intimate Memoir from Queen Mary to Meghan Markle, has claimed palace insiders told him about an incident when Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, “lost her temper” at a staffer. Speaking to the Daily Star, Quinn described an alleged incident where Meghan felt she was not being treated with the same respect as Kate, Duchess of Cambridge, while she and husband Prince Harry lived at the Palace.Meghan and Harry were living in whataposs called Nottingham Cottage and itaposs probably the only bit that you genuinely really could say, is actually quite small,” Quinn said.  And so, I think that reminded Meghan that she was, as it were, second place or as the runner-up. So, when Harry and Will got together and sometimes Meghan and Kate as well because there was this tension occasionally, famously Meghan slightly lost her temper with a member of Kateaposs staff in front of Kate. And it was that incident, that I was told by someone who was actually there, who said it was really uncomfortable because Meghan just lost it with this person.  The reason she lost it with Kateaposs member of staff was that she, Meghan, didnapost feel that this person was giving her the sort of attention she deserved. It was almost asin that one encounter, it encapsulated for Meghan the problem that she had, that sheaposs a Princess and sheaposs number two. He added: She was very successful, coming into this alien environment where people behave towards you according to where you are in the status of who becomes King or Queen next, thataposs just alien to her. The way it was described to me was, there were raised voices and foot-stamping. It is further claimed that the incident left Kate feeling really upset.  Mr Quinn continued: Meghan asked this person, I know who it was, but I canapost say because it will give away my source, who works for Kate who was basically asked to do something by Meghan and said, aposIaposm really sorry I canapost do that because I work for Kateapos. And Meghan really felt she had been slightly put in her place becauseyou become a Princess, you kind of assume that staff when you ask them to do something, they are going to do it. He added: Shewas horried, she was really upset because sheaposs very fond of this particular member of staff and she thought that Meghan almost bowling out this person was just completely unacceptable. Sheaposs very sensitive about not being treated with the same respect that she feels Kate is, so can react badly and doesnapost take it lying down. The Duchess of Sussex has been contacted for comment. title: mum told must accept solar
story: Mum told she must accept solar  on council home or go back on waiting listBrittany Haughton, from Stoke, claims she cant afford the solar  on her council home but is unable to have them removed as there is a  year deal in placeBrittany Haughton has said she cant afford her solar  Image: Stoke Sentinel BPM MEDIAByFahad TariqTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments A mum who lives with her disabled daughter claims she is paying through the roof for her electricity from solar  but canapost have them removed from her council home. Brittany Haughton is demanding that the  are removed and she has already turned them off, reports Stoke Live. The -year-old, who has autism, moved into the -bedroomed council house in December  after being on the waiting list for over two years.And now she is locked into a -year long contract with the Community Energy Schemewhich she wants to end. But Brittany either has to accept the solar  or go back onto the waiting list for a house without the modern roof.  The house in Blurton is a Stoke-on-Trent City Council property but the fuel bill issues have caused Brittany extreme anxiety.The mum-of-two told Stoke-on-Trent Live : “The  were not saving me any money. I was still paying through the roof for electricity. I don’t see the point of them being on.“It has been stressing me out. I’m a single mum - it’s just shocking. I am worried in case debt collectors come knocking on my door. “I’ve got autism so I have problems in social situations. I struggle to read body language as well. I don’t like going out at all and I don’t like strangers in my home. I don’t need this. My anxiety is through the roof.” Brittany added: “If I hadn’t accepted this house I would have gone back on the waiting list. I first went on the list in  so I had already been waiting for two years.  “This was my ideal house and I needed it because one of my girls has special needs so she requires her own space so I had to accept the house, I couldn’t afford to wait any longer. “I want the solar  down - I’ve always wanted that. I’m very disappointed.” CES says any tenants who turn off the solar  are in breach of its contract.A CES spokesman said: “Throughout the coronavirus pandemic we were extremely conscious that many people were impacted financially.We were therefore very flexible in our approach to customer payments, and set up a bespoke Stoke-based team who recently started conversations with those customers who were not paying their bills to see how we could support them in doing so. “Options available to customers who engage with our team and provide an accurate meter reading could, for example, include -month payment plans or an export to the traditional energy grid for new energy use.  “Given our supply and charges are not impacted by wholesale supply or costs, we reduced our base price for solar usage by five per cent from October . “In practical terms that’s an average saving of  per cent against Ofgem’s current price cap. “Ofgem has now indicated that it will increase the price cap by over  per cent in April. Taking anticipated inflation into account, we expect that in April our prices will be in the region of  per cent cheaper than the price cap. “We’ve worked hard to find a way to get sustainable and affordable energy to those who would otherwise completely miss out. “We know ours is currently the only way to achieve this – there is no alternative scheme with the same offering – and we are determined to make it as easy and beneficial as possible to our customers. “We continue to welcome all tenants to get in touchthey have any questions or concerns so that we can take appropriate action to support them.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Solar powerproperty newsHousing" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts from our Property Market newsletterSubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: national lottery voucher offer deal
story: Get a £ voucher* for the UKs best attractions using a National Lottery ticketYou can use a Lotto ticket to claim a £ voucher* to redeem when booking any one of hundreds of attractionsAdvertorialByDave MastersDigital Commercial Editor:,  Jan Updated:,  Feb Whether you’re eight or , exploring new places brings out the adventurer inside us all.And in the UK we’re spoiled for choice, with hundreds of incredible attractions to fire up the imagination.Thrill seekers of all ages will find adrenaline-filled rides at Zip World or Legoland. Those who prefer a more relaxing experience can enjoy autumn’s spectacular show of colours at venues like Kew Gardens, Cardf Castle or RHS Garden Bridgewater – a major horticultural project near Salford. History fans will adore a trip to the gothic ruins at Whitby Abbey, Warwick or Stirling Castle, while animal lovers can meet Ruby the red panda, born in July at Edinburgh Zoo, or three adorable tiger cubs at Highland Wildle Park. Click here toabout National Lottery Days Out and redeem your £ voucher*. And you can use a Lotto ticket purchased on or after October ,  to claim a £ voucher* to redeem when booking any one of hundreds of attractions. Not only will you enjoy a discounted day trip, you can feel proud that you’ve helped fund many of the tourist and heritage sites that make the UK unique. By playing The National Lottery, you raise £million for good causes every week.  National Lottery players have supported  of the top  most visited tourist attractions in the UK**, from castles to wildle parks, botanical gardens to museums and plenty of other fun stuff. Every adventure starts with a finger on a map. So where will yours land Highland Wildle Park: Meet animals from all over the worldGet up close to some endangered animals from the world’s mountains and tundra in the stunning setting of the Cairngorms National Park. From the comfort of your car you’ll encounter bison, elk and red deer – then visit the tigers and polar bears on foot using the park’s trails. Many nativeanimals are here too, including the capercaillie, European grey wolf, wolverine, lynx, Scottish wildcat and beavers. Cardf Castle: Enjoy a great day in history It has a history that stretches back to Roman times, a keep dating from the Norman Conquest, a spectacular moat and great views over the city that sits just beside it. Cardf Castle makes for one brilliant family day out. You’ll learn that it was once home to the world’s richest man, and was used as a giant air raid shelter during the Nazi bombardment of the city. Kids will love standing beside the huge replica trebuchet – a six-ton medieval weapon built for a movie that was filmed at the castle. After you’ve toured the building, stroll around its beautul grounds, or explore the city itself.Stonehenge: Explore this wonderful World Heritage Site Get close to this mysterious monument that dates back nearly , years. This awe-inspiring embodiment of human ingenuity offers a direct connection to our ancient past, and is a bucket-list destination for visitors around the world. title: prince charles tells prince andrew
story: Prince Charles tells Prince Andrew to stay out of sight amid sex scandalPrince Charles has allegedly told his brother Prince Andrew to stay "out of the line of sight" and he could eventually have to give up Royal Lodge amid his sex case in the USPrince Charles has allegedly told Andrew to stay out of sight Image: Getty ImagesByRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb Prince Charles has effectively banished under fire brother Andrew from Windsor Castle, it has been claimed.The future king, , has allegedly told his younger sibling, , to stay out of the line of sight and it could mean the Duke of York and ex-we Sarah Ferguson eventually moving out of Royal Lodge. Sources reportedly say the Prince of Wales and we Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall, , are on the warpath ahead of Andrewaposs trial in New York later this year. Charles is said to feel his brother misled him when the scandal surrounding paedophile friend Jeffrey Epstein and sex-trafficking victim Virginia Giuffre first reared its head.  Prince Andrew is understood to have assured him the allegations would come to nothing. Last month, the Queen summoned him to a -minute meeting in which he was told he would be stripped of his royal privileges.A source reportedly told The Sun : Charles wants Andrew out of the line of sight and out of the picture. He has been warned to keep his head down. Charles does not want Andrew to be photographed every other day looking happy and waving as he is driven to the castle. Eventually Andrew will be made to leave Windsor and could get several million pounds from the Royal Family. But he has made it clear that he will hang on for dear le.Charles, whose influence is said to be growing since the death of his father Prince Philip last year, is understood to have been alarmed when Ms Giuffre lodged a sexual abuse writ.The Duke of York is due to make his deposition in the case next month. Andrew is due to make his deposition in the Giuffre case on March . He could stand trial as a private citizen in autumn, or settle out of court. The Mirror approached Buckingham Palace and Clarence House for comment - both declined to comment. title: prince george soon move schools
story: Prince George may soon move schools and head to mum Kate Middletons alma materPrince William and Kate, Duchess of Cambridges eldest children Prince George, eight, and Princess Charlotte, six, could be heading to Marlborough Collegethe family make a move to WindsorPrincess Charlotte arrives for her first day of school with her family Image: Getty ImagesByJanet Hughes:,  Feb |commentsPrince George and Princess Charlotte could be ferried up the M for their educationpredictions about their next school are to be believed. The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge aposs eldest children Prince George, eight, and Princess Charlotte, six, currently attend Thomasaposs Battersea School in London. But a rumoured move for the family from Amner House in Norfolk to Windsor Castle has raised questions about their future scholastic destinations, Gloucestershire Live reported.Some believe the Duchess of Cambridge already has her eye on her old school - Marlborough College - where the childrenaposs cousin Savannah is thought to be heading.Equally, a move to Windsor - where Eton College is situated - could be on the cards for George and Louis,they are to follow in the footsteps of Prince William and his younger brother Harry. Sources close to the couple have previously claimed that William was determined to break tradition. He is said to want George to remain a day pupil at Thomasaposs Battersea in London which is seen as a family-run, feeder school for the top public schools. The option may prove particularly tempting as the school is opening a senior wing in September, meaning George could stay there until he is .Others have put money on Marlborough College as a future destination for the kids. The elite private school is just over the border from Windsor in Wiltshire and is only an houraposs drive up the M from Windsor. Both Eton and Marlborough in Wiltshire are full boarding schools that take in pupils at the age of , but Marlborough has one big advantage over Eton. Marlborough is mixed-sex, so Princess Charlotte would be able to join him when she is old enough. This may be preferable to Eton, which only takes boys.  US Weekly reported that the Duke and Duchess had “open conversations” with George about whether to send him to boarding school, so the young prince may also have his say. A friend told the Daily Mail in : “Eton hasn’t been ruled out but they have talked atabout Marlborough as an option and the smart money is on George going there instead. “William and Catherine surprised many with their choice of Thomas’s Battersea for George over more traditional royal schools but picked it because they felt it was the right fit for him. They are very keen to allow George to spread his wings as a child and won’t ever do what people expect them to do when it comes to their children.” Fees are unlikely to be a deciding factor, even though Eton charges £, per year compared to Marlboroughaposs £, per annum for boarders.Eton can boast  prime ministers such as David Cameron and Boris Johnson among its rank.Other royals such as the Duke of Kent, and actors including Eddie Redmayne and Tom Hiddleston, also attended the school. Former Marlborough pupils include Princess Eugenie, comedian Jack Whitehall and Samantha Cameron - the we of former Prime Minister David. The decision will likely be an important one for Kate, who allegedly moved to Marlborough from Downe House because she was being bullied. She is said to have blossomed at Marlborough and left in July  to attend the University of St Andrews. Royal expert Duncan Larcombe told OK!: They [Kate and William] may well plump for Eton, the school where kings and prime ministers go. I wouldn’t be surprisedthey plumped for Kate’s school, Marlborough. It’s a mixed school and a very good one, so they might want to make a statement and send the children there. It is not knownthe family are considering any state schools. title: prince harry may been taken
story: Prince Harry may have been taken aback by Queens Camilla announcement, expert claimsPrince Charles spoke to his sons Harry and William in the run-up to Her Majestys announcement that Camillas title would be Queen when Charles ascends the thronePrince Harry may have been taken aback by the Queens announcement about Camilla, a royal expert says Image: Get ReadingByMatthew DreschNews Reporter:,  Feb |commentsPrince Harry may have been taken aback by the monarchaposs announcement that Camilla will become the Queen when Charles ascends the throne, a royal expert has claimed.Her Majesty upgraded Camillaaposs future title from Princess Consort to Queen Consort in an extraordinary message last week.Now royal expert Peter Kay writes in the Mail that Harry may have been taken aback by the decision.Prince Charles spoke to both his sons about the change in the weeks leading up to the announcement. It is understood he personally called the Duke of Sussex to tell him the news, something which may have surprised his second son, writes Mr Kay.Mr Kay wrote: It is entirely possible that Harry was taken aback by his grandmotheraposs announcement.What do you make of what Peter Kay wrote  Respond in the comment section Sources close to William indicated that he was not part of the decision-making process, so it is, therefore, extremely unlikely Harry was. The story of the relationship between the brothers and the woman who never wanted to be their stepmother was always awkward and frequently tense. Neither of the princes shared public statements immediately after the Queenaposs announcement, although William was reportedly apossupportiveapos of the decision.Meanwhile, Harry paid tribute to his mum Diana when he broke his silence four days after the announcement.Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. He praised her charity work and said he could aposnever fill her shoesapos. Taking the statement as a pointed reference to Camilla, Mr Kay added: He might just as well have added aposand nor could anyone apos. The royal expert warned that a lack of warmth on the part of Harry towards his step-mother could be interpreted as a snub. Back in , Harry called Camilla a aposwonderful womanapos who made his father aposvery, very happyapos. Mr Kay said it is now hard to relate Harryaposs praise for Camilla with his failure to acknowledge Camillaaposs new future title.In her announcement, the Queen said: “When, in the fullness of time, my son Charles becomes King, I know you will give him and his we Camilla the same support that you have given me. “And it is my sincere wish that, when that time comes, Camilla will be known as Queen Consort as she continues her own loyal service.” A spokesman for Charles said: “The Prince of Wales and the Duchess of Cornwall are touched and honoured by Her Majesty’s words.”Former BBC royal correspondent Peter Hunt said of the Queen’s announcement: “This is the most extraordinary message.”And recalling Diana’s Panorama interview in , Mr Hunt added: “For Camilla, the journey from being the third person in a marriage to queen-in-waiting, is complete.” Dickie Arbiter, a former press secretary to the Queen, said hostility towards Camilla after the  death of Diana “has evaporated completely”. He added: “The Duchess has shown that she is a great support to Charles, the Queen and the institution.” Royal author Dr Andrew Lownie said: “Camilla has earned her spurs. The Queen, who wouldn’t have Camilla in the room at one point, has become very fond of her. “I think there’s a real sense of the passing on of the crown.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Prince HarryRoyal FamilyCamilla, Duchess of Cornwall" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: puppy accidentally overdosed vet after
story: Puppy accidentally overdosed at vet after syringe mix-up during routine operationAmy Marenghi claims her six-month-old puppy, Phoebe, was left dazed and traumatised after she was given the wrong drug following a syringe mix-up at a vet practicePhoebe was left dazed and traumatised after she was accidentally overdosed during a routing operation at a vet practice Image: Daily RecordByGemma RyderSam TrueloveNews reporter:,  Feb |commentsA furious dog owner has claimed her pet could have died after it was accidentally overdosed during a routing operation at a vet practice. Amy Marenghi says her six-month-old puppy, Phoebe, was left dazed and traumatised after she was given the wrong drug following a syringe mix-up.Phoebe had been taken to VetsPets at Glasgow Forge to be spayed on Wednesday morning when the mix-up occurred, Daily Record reports.When I first saw Phoebe I was in such a state of shock that I just left the vets with my mum, Amy said. Then it hit me that my dog could have died. I was raging. They caused unnecessary trauma. This is not okay, this could have resulted in a very dferent outcome. Our pets are supposed to be in their safe hands. I donapost want this to happen to any other pet.  Within hours of dropping Phoebe off, Amy received a phone call from the practice explaining that her pet had reacted to a drug and they couldnapost go ahead with the surgery. Amy was told to come to the vet practice to pick up her puppy just after lunchtime. When I got there she seemed absolutely dazed and I pressed to find out what had happened, Amy continued. The nurse then told me that she had accidentally been administered too much of the sedative but it was reversed as soon as they realised. I just wanted to get Phoebe home and I could tell that she just wasnapost herself, her eyes were really heavy and she was just cuddling into me because she was so traumatised. Amy was later told that Phoebe was given two drugs - one she took a reaction to and the other was too high a dose.  The retail worker said: I had not been told the truth. I believe thatthat nurse hadnapost told me what had actually happened I would be none the wiser. When I asked how did this happen, they just said the nurse had picked up the wrong syringe. I askedthings werenapost dual controlled but they couldnapost really give me an answer. She added: I said to the vet, Phoebe could have died, but his reply was just aposbut she didnapostapos. He was rude, and I felt he came across like he didnapost care. Thankfully Phoebe started to perk up on Thursday but this incident was careless. Iaposm taking a complaint to an independent authority. Amy requested Phoebeaposs medical notes but says there was nothing in the report to say there had been a mix-up with the syringes. A VetsPets spokesperson said: “Pet welfare is always our number one priority and we immediately informed Ms Marenghi of the error that occurred in administering Phoebe with her pre-procedure medication. The mistake was quickly addressed and Phoebe received continuous monitoring throughout the day. We are pleased that Phoebe has recovered and are very sorry for any upset and distress this situation has caused. We would also like to offer reassurances that whilst we already have robust processes in place to guard against such incidents, we will conduct a full process review and implement any appropriate findings. title: tiny twins born size mars
story: Exclusive: Tiny twins born the size of a Mars Bar with ZERO chance of survival thriving  days onMinuscule Harley and Harry Crane weighed g, or .lbs when they were born at  weeks - doctors initially told mum Jade that she was having a miscarriage and gave them no chance of pulling throughJade snuggles her twins at  weeksByAmy SharpeNews Reporter:,  Feb |commentsThe weakest of cries from the tiniest of tots signalled a medical miracle as premature twins Harley and Harry Crane entered the world. The mites, weighing just  grams, or .lbs, arrived when mum Jade was  weeks and five days pregnant. Barely cmlong – theof a king-size Mars Bar – doctors gave them zero chance of survival as Jade went into premature labour. They told the desperate mum-to-be she was having a miscarriage. Then came that wail – “like a tiny kitten”, says Jade. In a flash, medics burst into action to save what are believed to be the most premature twins to be born and survive in Britain.  They were delivered more than week before a foetus is deemed medically viable. And their gentle sobs were music to the ears of Jade and husband Steve, who had spent  years and £, trying to become parents. Speaking exclusively to the Sunday Mirror, Jade, , says: “When Harley let out the smallest of cries the room went mad and they suddenly offered le-saving treatment. “It was the same with Harry, who was inside me still for a full hour unmonitored. The babies had been given a zero percent chance of survival. “It felt amazing to hear them cry, though I was still scared.” But the tough siblings weren’t going anywhere and have gone from strength to strength – amazing doctors at the Queen’s Medical Centre in Nottingham.  Early pictures show just how tiny the babies were – their arms barely the size of their dad’s finger. “At birth they were smaller than an elf on the shelf,” Jade explains. “There wasn’t a nappy small enough. The smallest clothes are for babies up to .kg – well mine were g.” At birth their handspan was cm. It is now cm and they have doubled into cm. NHS worker Jade beams: “I’m so proud of my babies – they’re little fighters. For them to get through everything and still be there just smiling away is incredible. If they can do that, they can do anything.”Now  weeks, Harry and sister Harley could be discharged by their due date on February . In their quest to be parents, Jade and Steve, , endured  years of treatments – including eight cycles of IVF and several implantations of frozen embryos.They tried to conceive naturally for three years and Jade suffered an ectopic pregnancy before they began IVF in . The couple took out loans and worked hard to pay for £,-worth of treatment – which “nearly bankrupted us”.By late , Jade had another three miscarriages after IVF and was told she had an overactive immune system causing her body to reject pregnancy. But Jade and Steve, who works in sales, refused to give up hope. “We just wanted a family so bad and I’d had embryos frozen so we had a need to use them,” Jade says. The couple, who live in Derbyshire, made contact with another fertility clinic – in London’s Harley Street and reputededly one of the best in the world. Jade was prescribed medication to combat immune system problems.  Then, last May – IVF cycle number eight – the couple had two embryos transferred. Both worked and they were told they were expecting boy and girl twins. “I couldn’t let myself believe it,” Jade recalls. “I was so fearful of a miscarriage or something going wrong. I literally didn’t do anything during the pregnancy as a result. “The few bits of clothes that I did buy made me think that I better keep the tags on just in case – you just don’t want to let yourself believe.” On October  Jade went to get checked out after leaking fluid. An examination revealed she was experiencing membrane ruptures that happen before the onset of labour. Doctors are not required to medically intervene with babies born prior to  weeks as they are not considered to be viable. But Jade had chosen Queen’s as it has a more extensive neonatal intensive care unit than her local centre.  And, as a teaching hospital, staff intervene with babies born from  weeks to learn about premature births. At the time of going into labour, Jade was  hours away from the -week mark and was told she was likely to lose her precious twins. “It was so scary,” she shudders. “The doctor kept saying it was a miscarriage but I said it couldn’t be because I could feel the babies moving. I knew they were OK but was being told they wouldn’t survive at this stage of gestation. Labour happened really quickly. I was denied pain medication and monitoring during labour as I wasn’t viable, which was awful.” Doctors chose to intervene after her babies showed signs of le when born. Jade adds: “I remember saying that I couldn’t hear Harley cry and one of the nurses said I wouldn’t because she was far too early. “But then I heard this cry, like a tiny kitten. Harry did the same when he was born an hour later, still in his sac. In Japan, it is seen as being luckyyou have a baby born in their sac, so I held on to that luck!” Harley and Harry were incubated and whisked to the NICU – Neonatal Intensive Care Unit– where they remained on ventilators as doctors worked hard to save them. Two hours later, Jade was wheeled to the unit to meet her miracle twins. “I was in disbelief,” she says. “It was amazing. But seeing them so tiny and fragile in the NICU was scary with the doctor’s predictions in my head.” Desperate for hope, Jade and Steve searched out a mother of American twins born at  weeks, who are now four. They spoke via Instagram and Jade says: “She guided me through the first few days of being in the unit and what to ask for.”But things took a bleak turn at a week old when the twins were diagnosed with gastrointestinal illness necrotising enterocolitis. It can be fatal and the parents were told to prepare to say goodbye. It was a hellish time. Jade says: “We were told to get the family in and have a christening. “I kept referring to the christening as ‘the funeral’. It was just awful.” But the little fighters pulled through. Previously, the UK’s most premature twins to survive were Brighton tots Jenson and Reuben Powell, born at  weeks and six days, in . Jade got to hold her twins for the first time when they were four weeks.“It felt amazing to finally feel them moving again,” she smiles. The twins have had more health problems as a result of their premature birth, including chronic lung disease and sepsis, and have undergone six surgeries between them. But the siblings – who now weigh .kg, or .lbs – have defied the odds and are thriving in the NICU, where they have now spent  days. Jade goes on: “We are working towards the twins coming home on my due date. Usually doctors would tell us what they did with other babies at the same age, but they don’t have any  weekers to base it on because it just doesn’t happen. I’m really lucky that I went to Queen’s instead of my local hospital. If I’d gone there, I wouldn’t have come home with any babies, and it’s where the ambulance would have taken me because of the catchment – it’s a postcode lottery.” Matron Cheryl Grfiths and consultant Chantelle Tomlinson told the Mirror: “We are delighted to have been able to provide neonatal intensive care for Harley and Harry and to support them and their parents, Jade and Steve, in their journey.” Once discharged, the twins are likely to require oxygen at home and may suffer long-term issues. But Jade adds: “They’ll go down in medical history. I’m sure they’ll have a ward named after them because everyone is just amazed by them!” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON NHSHarry CraneBabiesHospitalsPregnancyGiving birthImmune systemMiscarriageTwinsIVFFertility" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: uks biggest family radfords 22
story: UKs biggest family the Radfords with  kids to expand as daughter shares pregnancyMillie Radford, one of Sue and Noels  children, has announced with a cute Instagram pic that she is pregnant and is set to welcome a ninth grandchild for her parentsMillie Radford has announced she is pregnant Image: millieeradfordd instagramByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Feb |commentsBritain’s biggest family is getting larger as Millie, one of the  children of the Radford family, has announced she is pregnant.Millie, , is the seventh eldest of the children and she will be welcoming her parents with a ninth grandchild.She revealed the news with an Instagram snap showing her baby bump while holding her daughter Ophelia.The photo was captioned: “Happy due date little man. Ophelia is obsessed with her little brother already.” She also told Radford fans that Friday was her due date.Sibling Chloe, who is also pregnant, said that she is looking to meet the new member of the family.She wrote: “We cannot wait to meet him. O is gonna be the best big sister.”  Many others replied on Instagram wishing Millie “congratulations”. One said: “Congrats Millie, Ophelia will be a great big sister.” Parents Sue and Noel are parents to Chris, , Sophie, , Chloe, , Jack, , Daniel, , Luke, , Millie, , Katie, , James, , Ellie, , Aimee, , Josh, , Max, , Tillie, , Oscar, , Casper, nine, Hallie, six, Phoebe, five, Archie, four, Bonnie, three, and Heidie, one.  Their th child Alfie was still born on July , . The family famously doesn’t rely on benefits and is supported by their pie shop business.While some of the older children have moved out and started families of their own, the majority of the Radfords all live in an enormous ten bedroom house in Morecambe.The family recently packed the pews of their local church, including all  of their children, to celebrate the christening of the two youngest members.Sue and Noel took part in the final christening for their two youngest daughters Heidi and Bonnie in the most recent episodeof Channel  series ‘ Kids  Counting’, which documents the family’s often-hectic le. The gathering in Morecambe Parish church was the first time four generations of the Radford family had gathered in one place in over two years, due to the coronavirus pandemic, the Daily Star reports.Perhaps unsurprisingly, the vicar Catherine Hayden was daunted but excited by the prospect of managing such an enormous brood.  “This is my first Radford baptism,” Catherine admitted. “I love doing baptisms, and I love having a church full of children, so it is a very exciting thing to be doing.” “I don’t think I’ve ever seen that many people from one immediate family in a church, it’s great to have them here though.” Despite the stresses of the day’s preparations, Bonnie and Heidi’s ceremony went largely unhitched. There were a few tears from Bonnie when the vicar dripped holy water onto her head, while Heidi pulled a rather bemused expression. “It was nice, a nice little service, Bonnie wasn’t overly pleased with the holy water side of it, but yeah, she’s alright now,” Noel reflected. “It’s been a really stressful week, but the kids have come through,” Sue added. title: woman 34 misdiagnosed three years
story: Woman, , misdiagnosed for three years desperately needs £, to treat rare cancerFor almost three years, Laura Gilmore Anderson had her pain dismissed by GPs and doctors until she was eventually diagnosed with a rare and incurable form of cancerLaura Gilmore Anderson has travelled the world in an effort to treat the untreatable Image: Laura Gilmore AndersonByKieren WilliamsNews Reporter:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments A -year-old woman spent nearly three-years having her worries and pain dismissed by doctors before being diagnosed with a rare and incurable form of cancer.Laura Gilmore Anderson, born in Longford Ireland but now living in Glasgow, Scotland, has travelled the world in an effort to treat the untreatable. She has a rare type of cancer called Neuroendocrine which started in her pancreas and has spread during the years she was misdiagnosed. For nearly three years, Laura was repeatedly turned away from doctors when she complained about pain in her stomach and back. To make matters worse, at the time, Laura and her husband, Paul Anderson, were trying for a child. Laura said: “I was in and out of the GP with lots of lower abdominal pain and lower back pain. “When I had blood taken they would just say it was a viral infection, continuously, just say viral infection until I persisted and pushed. Have you got a similar story to tell  Email webnews@mirror  “I was always missing work and we were trying to conceive after we got married in . “You’re explaining that to the GP and I just thought there was something wrong with me, something related to oies or something like that. But they never investigated more early on.” Laura was repeatedly dismissed by her GP and told she just had an infection and she woud be fine. On one occasion when her pain was investigated, they found a swollen spleen but she was dismissed and told it would go down with time. Then, to make matters worse, the pandemic hit, and Laura’s le, like that of so many others, was thrown into turmoil. As GP surgeries shted to virtual or phone call triages and appointments, Laura often found herself in agony without medical support.  She said: “I was in and out of AE during Covid, getting ultrasounds and loads of other scans. “In January  when I was at my worst healthwise, the pain was so severe, I got a scan, and on it, it showed I had a swollen spleen. “They said to me there and then, you’re young, you’re fit, you’re healthy and it’ll go down in time. “I went back in April, the easiest thing was to go back to AE otherwise I was not being seen.” Laura constantly battled back and forth to be seen and taken seriously. In May she had three separate scans to try and figure out why she was in pain. Doctors eventually thought she had endometriosis after looking into her oies and referred her to a fertility clinic. Laura said: “I didn’t give up, I had to go back into AE for a third time [in June] and had an ultrasound and met a radiologist and they saw a shadow on the scan and put me in for an MRI. “That’s when then they called me into the GP and told me ‘you have a tumour in your pancreas, it looks like pancreatic cancer, you have three months to live’ and at this time I hadn’t seen any of my family in a while, and they were like ‘You need to go home to your family’.” After her diagnosis, Laura was put on chemotherapy but said that it didn’t work for her and instead of bringing the tumour down, her cancer spread to her lymph nodes. With the help of her husband, they began looking for other treatments for her ‘incurable’ cancer. After speaking to a neuroendocrine specialist from Manchester, she came across a clinic in Mexico that offered alternative treatments. Laura chose to pursue the treatments not offered on the NHS, including “non-toxic” medicine and focusing on the “mental and emotional roots” of the cancer.However, the clinic costs in excess of £, for an approximately three-week course, so Laura was forced to turn to fundraising to get there. Family, friends and loved ones from Ireland rallied round and in only a few days she raised the money she initially needed. However, when she was out there she was told by the clinic she’d need more treatment which would cost even more, forcing her to turn to fundraising once more. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. After she ed, she combined the treatments and approach from the clinic, with radiation therapy in Glasgow to try and treat her cancer.She is nowfundraisingagain to try and raise £, so she can afford a six month course with the clinic once again.She said: “Somethingaposs working, I’m still alive. The specialist in Glasgow said something’s working but we don’t know what, they’re sceptical about the help the clinic offers. “Every penny means so much for us, and it’s hope for the future.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON NHSBack painTherapyCancer" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: woman who couldnt walk end
story: Woman who weighed st and couldn’t walk to end of road sheds  stone with simple dietA woman, from Hampshire, has shared her weight loss transformation and explained that she never had "a great relationship with food" beforehandAngela, from Hampshire, admitted she never had a great relationship with food Image: Slimming World ExpressByAndrea BlazquezKatie L Wilson:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsA woman has managed to lose over five stone by making a few simple changes to her diet. Angela, from Hampshire, admitted she never had a great relationship with food,” as she shared her weight loss transformation. She explained: “After the birth of my second child I fell very ill with leukaemia. My marriage broke down, I lost my hearing due to the cancer treatment, and I wasn’t able to do my job anymore.I was feeling low, and the weight crept on, my blood pressure was high, and I had a number of health issues. When I moved area with my children and new partner Phil, I made the decision to lose weight and start taking care of myself.“I tried to lose weight in the first lockdown, but I couldn’t do it on my own and I knew I needed the support of a group. This is when Angela decided to join Slimming World.She explained: “I was slightly nervous going to my first group and couldn’t believe it when I stood on the scales to find I was  stone . pounds. I cried when I realised my BMI was in the obese category. “Emma and the other members were so kind and welcoming, though, and they put me right at ease. From the moment I arrived, I felt no judgement, only acceptance. Going to group has been a lesaver for me, it has helped me to set goals, understand where I might trip up on my weight-loss journey, and put plans in place to make sure I continue to lose weight.Angela admitted that before starting her weight loss journey, she didn’t really pay attention to what she was eating. But now I really enjoy trying new Slimming World recipes, and I never feel hungry. I’ve been able to adapt Slimming World’s Food Optimising plan to create meals my family enjoy, and make healthy swaps, like using leaner meat and less oil. “For a long time I’ve been unable to even walk to the end of my road without getting out of breath, but with the support from my Slimming World group, I started introducing exercise slowly, and now I enjoy going swimming three to four times a week, and when I can’t go you’ll find me going for a long walk.  She continued: “I’m still on my weight-loss journey, but I’m so proud of how far I’ve come. I always wore leggings before with large, baggy tops as nothing  fitted me, now I’ve lost weight I enjoy trying on clothes and really think about what I want to wear. Slimming World has given me the confidence in myself to continue making healthy changes and choices, and the energy to do all the things I want to.” Emma Jones, from Slimming World group, said: “Angela has fully embraced Slimming World’s Food Optimising and physical activity Body Magic programmes and is doing incredibly well. She is such an inspiration to our group and I’m so proud of how far she’s come.” Diet before Breakfast: Toast and cakeLunch: Sandwich, crisps, a fizzy drink and chocolateDinner: Breaded chicken with ketchup served on a roll or with chipsSnacks: Cake, chocolate, ice cream and sugary sweetsDiet after Breakfast: Yoghurt and fruit or mushroom omeletteLunch: Baked potato with baked beans or saladDinner: Cajun chicken with lots of veg and riceSnacks: Fruit and cereal barsMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Slimming WorldDietFitness" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: prince andrews pal who knows
story: Exclusive: Prince Andrews pal who knows more than most and could help duke in sex trialNeurosurgeon Dr Melanie Walker is said to know "more than most" about Prince Andrews relationship with paedophile Jeffrey Epstein - but its not clearshell be involved in his trialDr Melanie Walker refused to talk when askedshe would give evidence Image: Rowan Grfiths   Daily MirrorByChristopher BucktinUnited States Editor:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb  A pal of Prince Andrew who could be crucial to the royal’s lawsuit with rape accuser Virginia Giuffre has been tracked down by the Mirror.Neurosurgeon Dr Melanie Walker, , was introduced to the Duke of York by his paedophile friend Jeffrey Epstein, whose staff say she “knows more than most” about the two men’s friendship. The “captivating” doctor enjoyed such a close relationship with the Prince she was a guest at his th birthday party at Windsor Castle in , with Epstein and his “madam” Ghislaine Maxwell. But when asked by the Mirrorshe would be supporting Andrew, , in his lawsuit, she smiled behind her mask but declined to comment.Askedshe would give evidence on his behalf or give details about his friendship with Epstein, again she refused to talk. A former worker at Epstein’s Zorro ranch told the pair’s closeness. He said: “Melanie was incredibly charming, lovely and captivating, one of the most intelligent figures I ever met in Jeffrey’s world. “After she was introduced to Andrew, they just seemed to click. She knew him better than anyone in that circle. “They spent a lot of time together, inseparable even. I never saw them ­intimate, but other staff told me they had grown very, very close. She could not be more opposite to Virginia. Although they were both integral to Jeffrey, I never saw them meet. “Unless something went wrong between them [the Duke and Dr Walker], I suspect she would be very supportive of Andrew. “I would think her evidence could only be to his advantage. She knows more than most about how close Epstein and Andrew were and the time they spent together.” It is not knownDr Walker, who the Duke jokingly called “smartypants” and “dork”, has been approached by his legal team to give a statement. The Mirror understands Ms Giuffre’s lawyers have no intention of subpoenaing the medic. There is no suggestion Dr Walker knew or was present when Epstein and Maxwell are accused of abusing girls or knew anything about the allegations surrounding Andrew.  Former Zorro housekeeper Deidre Stratton claimed Andrew was “given” Dr Walker to keep him company for three days when he stayed at the ranch in  or  when Epstein was not there. She said the Duke, then  or , was put up in a self-contained three-bedroom guest property on the estate. She added: “At the time, Jeffrey had this, she supposedly was a neurosurgeon, quite young, ­beautul, brilliant, and she stayed in the home with him.” Deirdre said she saw no sexual activity between Andrew and Dr Walker, then . A former personal protection officer of the Prince said the pari were alone for most of their stay at Zorro, having only occasional contact with staff.Referring to his notes taken at the time, the bodyguard said Epstein and Maxwell joined them for “at least one night”, but they were the only visitors. The officer was adamant it was the only time the Duke ever visited Zorro. This contradicts court-made claims by Epstein’s former teen “sex slave” Ms Giuffre that she was once flown there alone to spend time with Andrew – an allegation the royal unequivocally denies. The bodyguard said he is sure the Prince never met or saw Ms Giuffre during his time with the Duke. Dr Walker was at the Dance of the Decades party which the Queen threw for milestones, including Andrew’s th birthday. Also there were Epstein, who died in jail aged  in  awaiting trial on child sex-trafficking charges and Maxwell, , who in December was convicted of procuring, grooming and trafficking young girls.  Dr Walker, a professor of neurological surgery at the University of ­Washington School of Medicine, has previously praised the Duke. In a  interview, she said they were friends who talked “mostly about science and medicine” and kept in touch via email. She met Epstein in  while visiting New York after graduating from the University of Texas. He approached her while she was having tea at the Plaza Hotel and told her he could get her an audition to model for Victoria’s Secret as he knew owner Lex Wexner. She decided to finish medical school instead. From  to  records show her listed at a Manhattan address owned by Epstein where she would stay when visiting New York.  She became his science adviser in  and a year later began to appear as a passenger on flight logs for his “Lolita Express” jet. She later met Steven Sinofsky, , a senior executive at Microsoft and moved to Seattle to be with him. They live in a £.million flat overlooking Elliott Bay. In  she joined the Gates Foundation. She reportedly introduced Epstein to Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates. Ms Giuffre, , is suing for unspecied damages that US lawyers have said could top £million. The American mum-of-three claims that in  when she was  – underage in US law – she was trafficked to London by Maxwell and Epstein to have sex with Andrew. Ms Giuffre also alleges she was forced to have sex with the Prince at Epstein’s home in New York and the US Virgin Islands. Andrew emphatically denies her allegations. Last month he demanded a trial by jury in a bid to clear his name after failing to have her US civil lawsuit thrown out by a New York judge. The case is in the discovery phase, during which both sets of lawyers will grill witnesses under oath, including Andrew, his family and friends. title: bride bans fiancs pregnant sister
story: Bride bans fiancés pregnant sister from wedding as she wants to be the focal pointA bride-to-be has said she wants to ban her fiancés pregnant sister from their upcoming wedding over fears shell steal the spotlight from the couple with her baby bumpThe bride-to-be is refusing to let her fiances sister come to the weddingImage: Getty ImagesByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Feb |comments We all know itaposs a cardinal sin to make a grand gesture such as proposing at someone aposs wedding when the spotlight should be on the happy couple - but there seems to be a dference in opinion when it comes to inviting pregnant women to your big day. While many of us wouldnapost bat an eyelid and would be happy to welcome our friends and family to our wedding regardless of whether theyaposre pregnant, others see their baby bump as a warning sign, as guests may be tempted to fuss over them instead of keeping their attention on the bride and groom. The latter is the opinion of one -year-old woman on Reddit, who has actually banned her fiancéaposs own sister from attending their wedding because sheaposll be heavily pregnant at the time.Sharing her story anonymously, the woman explained her future sister-in-law, , is due to give birth two weeks after the wedding, and the bride doesnapost want her there as she believes she and her husband-to-be should be the focal point.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. She said: My fiancé has a -year-old little sister who he is close to and whom I really do like. Iaposm very excited to be her older sister-in-law. She was going to be a guest at our wedding, however, a few days ago we found out she is pregnant and plans on having the baby. Now Iaposm not going to sit here and shame her for her irresponsible actions or anything, but I felt like this was a very big deal. She is apparently due two weeks after the wedding. My worry is this: pregnant women require a lot of care and extra accommodation. Thereaposs also the risk of her water breaking at my ceremony and taking all the attention off me on my day. Call me selfish but I feel that I and my husband to be should be the focal point.  I donapost want to risk her giving birth and needing even more attention that should be placed on me. So I think she shouldnapost be there. The woman told her fiancé, , she doesnapost want his sister at the wedding - and he accused her of being selfish. She added: I told my fiancé and he got unbelievably p***ed off at me. He told me I was being a complete a**hole by not inviting her since heaposs her little sister. I get that they are very close, but itaposs not a good idea. Attention aside, I donapost think a nine-month pregnant teen should be on her feet at a wedding so close to her due date. He told me I was backpedalling and I should be ashamed of myself. He then told his whole family and they all are mad at me for suggesting this. Commenters on Reddit canapost believe the womanaposs cheek, with many of them telling her she needs to be more supportive of her pregnant future sister-in-law. One person wrote: This is a girl who is likely to face a lot of ostracism and challenges already and you seem eager to be first in line to make things harder for her. Be careful, because you are showing some truecolours to your future husband and in-laws. While another added: You will ruin your relationship with her forever by not inviting her. By extension, you will damage your relationship with your future husband since they are close. Get over yourself. And a third said: This is someone who is very important to your fiancé. Itaposs his day too and Iaposm sure he wants her to be there.Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON PregnancyWeddingsUmm what Wedding day" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: dream specialist shares meaning behind
story: Dream specialist shares meaning behind your nightmares - including teeth falling outDream specialist Delphi Ellis has shared the meaning behind several common nightmares including whats really going onyou are dreaming about your teeth falling outNightmares can leave you not wanting to sleepImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments While tucked up in bed at night asleep, some people have sweet dreams while others are plagued with nightmares. And there are a few very common nightmare topics that many experience time and time again - these may include teeth falling out, falling, dying and a partner cheating.But have you ever wondered what they really mean  If youaposve had any of these bad dreams and want to know whataposs going on, then youaposre in luck as a dream specialist has explained the truth behind the nightmares. Delphi Ellis has explained the meaning behind common nightmares - and what you can do about them.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here. Speaking to The Mirror, Delphi discussed what your teeth dreams mean.She said: This is a really common dream, the interpretation of which is steeped in traditional meaning. For some cultures the teeth represent people, so to dream of losing a tooth may symbolise a fear of losing someone close to you. Today, teeth can also represent status and wealth - so, again, to dream of onefalling out can suggest that money is an issue. The specialist went on to say: Lots of people dream that the teeth are crumbling into the mouth.  Anything in the mouth in a dream can symbolise a problem with communication, so have a think about with whom youaposre struggling to get your point across. Delphi also explained what dreams about death really mean - but it turns out there isnapost one simple explanation. We know, from years of research, that all dreams mean something. Everybody is dferent, so dreams of death will mean something unique to the dreamer, she shared. In some traditions, people come together and discuss their dreams each morning - dreaming of death was a good sign, with the prospect that this was news predicting a birth. Death in dreams can also reflect change we see in others or ourselves. If someone we love is behaving dferently, this can manest as a death in a dream.  She continued: Young mums often dream about the death of their babies, recognising the responsibility they feel for the safety of their child and the worry that something bad may happen. Parents may also have death dreams as children grow older, acknowledging that the vulnerable young person who depended on them is no longer there. Some people fear dreams of death are an omen that something bad is about to happen Iaposve met many people who have described predictive dreams, so itaposs understandable why some people worry it will come true when they dream that someone passes away. Thankfully though, dreams of death - whilst disturbing - mainly serve to remind us how precious le is and that we should make the most of every moment with the people we love and care about. Death dreams can be caused by anxiety, particularlywe have heard news of a passing or there is someone precious on our mind as we start to consider our own mortality we may be thinking about how time could be running out. Itaposs important to address anxiety and set yourself up for a good night sleep, by dealing with stress positively during the day and ensuring your bedroom environment is relaxing and calm. Delphi also told how there are two types of dream about falling - one where the dreamer aposrelishesapos the feeling of falling and the other where it is not enjoyable. The first likely means you have an adventure ahead of you and like not knowing where it will take you, while the latter suggests you are feeling out of control. Andyouaposve been having dreams about being cheated on, you might not need to instantly panic that itaposs your subconscious trying to tell you something. The expert added: Whilst itaposs fair to say we receive messages from our subconscious on many levels, this dream usually suggests a fear a partner will cheat, rather than evidence theyaposre actually doing that.Have you had dreams like this  Let us know in the comments below.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON SleepTeeth" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you.
